summary: Lost and Found (Steve Rogers X Teen!Reader) *PARENTAL, PLATONIC
title: Lost and Found (Steve Rogers X Teen!Reader) *PARENTAL, PLATONIC
body:
Characters: Steve Rogers X Teen!Reader

Universe: Marvel, Avengers

Warnings: Mention of blood, torture, death

Request: Ok i know your requests wont be open for at least an hour, but im about to lose service so i figured id give it a shot to request. So i had an idea for a steve rogers x deaf! Gender neutral! Reader where they find the teen on a mission and theyve been missing for a few years and their parents are dead so they would go to an orphanage but steve takes them in and they live in the avengers tower or something with steve xx (i copied and pasted this for my friend ))

A missing agent was always noticed and put as high priority. A missing agent in SHIELD meant possible imprisonment, secrets being spilled, torture, compromise and in the recent years, being used as a weapon was added to the list.

But this case was different, and in a bad way. Agent L/N, was married with a child, and all three had gone missing. They had no doubt that this was the work of HYDRA, and that mortified SHIELD even more because of a child being involved. All they were able to find was through searching the home and CCTV of their last known locations. Agent L/N was last seen leaving base, going missing between there and entering the city. Her husband had took the day off work to care for their child, Y/N L/N who had been ill, and camera’s showed your father rushing out the building holding you, barely 8 years old and still in pyjamas, jumping in the car and rushing away. Searching the house found no sign of a struggle, but there was a little bit of blood found in your bed, confirmed to be yours.

It had been 7 years, and the case was cold. It bothered a lot of people, and that included Steve Rogers. Especially Steve Rogers.

He wasn’t assigned to your case, but he had found your file report and Maria, who had been helping with the investigation told him you were a missing person under the protection of SHIELD. Steve straight out begged to be part of the case, and Fury allowed it. He found out everything that they had known about yours and your family’s case, and it made him sick to his stomach.

He came up with some theories that ultimately allowed the case to gain some heat. He came up with the theory that you had coughed up the blood and your father was planning to rush you to hospital, but got caught on the way there. That then brought up that you were supposedly ill with just a bit of vomiting from a school bug, proven by your mom going to pharmacy to pick up the tablets. However, he then asked if they had found the tablets in the house. They said yes, but hadn’t actually tested them. Turns out they were actually mild poison. It was all planned. You were ill, a bug probably passed around at your school, and they used it to their advantage. While it was progress, Steve still felt awful about the whole thing. He instructed an investigation on the pharmacist who sold the drugs, only to find out that he had been hired a week before hand, and left 5 weeks after your disappearance. There was no doubt he was with HYDRA, hired purely to make sure you got worse so your dad would take you to the hospital, and on the way they could attack. Your mom had left early, due to your dad calling to tell her about your condition. They’d used you, a child, as leverage. And that infuriated him.

The case went cold again after that, but it bothered Steve every day. He looked at your case every day, looking for something he could have missed. Eventually he realised that there was nothing else he could do without searching each and every HYDRA base and their files, or to imprison and torture a HYDRA agent until they spilled, but he didn’t want to be like them, so he chose the first option.

He was on another mission. SHIELD had found a base, so they sent Steve, Tony, Clint and Natasha to deal with it properly. They were having to move fast to get in before the group could destroy evidence, both inanimate and alive. “Tony, go from above, Clint, get to the second level, Natasha you’re first.” Steve ordered, throwing his shield to hit some agents with guns, punching through them and grabbing his shield again to proceed with Natasha through the first floor. Natasha went forward, dealing with the agents who hadn’t surrendered, while Steve noticed a door to the left. He got a bad- an awful feeling about that door, so he raised his shield, heading over to the door slowly. He could feel the agents all staring at him, and he knew that they were hiding something behind that door.

He opened it, finding stairs. “I’m heading down here Natasha, secure this place, I’ll be back soon.” Steve announced. Natasha only nodded as she worked in handcuffing the multitude of agents, before Steve jogged down the stairs.

He came to a room, both sides of the room occupied with cells with the wall made of glass to show everything inside. They left only a narrow hallway for Steve to walk passed, and he realised what was going on, and it made him sick. The rooms were clouded with some green gas, and he could see bodies of people pressed up against the glass, not moving. This gas was poisonous, and they’d been killed. He walked passed them all, looking at each until he froze at one. The body, while curled up, could be made out as Agent L/N, her face etched into madness and pain, but eyes dull and skin pale. “Shit…” He almost didn’t want to turn, but had to, seeing her husband in the opposite cell in a similar state. He felt everything he’d been trying to do for all those years on the case were for nothing, and it made him feel more angry that he’ll never know what HYDRA wanted from them or what they did to you… wait, where we you?

His eyes shifted, seeing only two more cells. The one next to your father was filled with the clouded poison, and he was worried that he had found you… but the body was too big. He walked a little further, looking into the last cell… and he saw you.

You’d given up. You were curled up, sat against the wall with your head in your knees, your back jolting lightly occasionally. You were crying. It tore Steve up, but also gave him hope. He had to get you out of here. He could see your cell clearly, seeing the ventilation, knowing they could fill the room and kill you at any second. He tightened his grip on his shield, pulling his arm back and hitting hit against the glass.

You jumped at the sound, away from the glass, seeing the man with a shield who had managed to crack the glass, though it didn’t shatter. You looked at him like he was the first human you’d seen in years, before snapping out of your moment when a hissing sound released from behind you. You looked back, seeing green smoke emerging from the vents. You knew what it was, and scrambled up, hitting the glass as well. “Please! Please!” You begged desperately. Steve took another swing at the glass, though it still wouldn’t shatter. You started to cough, the feeling of light headedness and tiredness filling your body. Your punches to the glass became weaker, until you fell to your knees. Steve continued to try and break the glass.

“Where’s Steve?” Tony asked after regrouping. The raid was a success, and they had all met on the first floor to hold all the surrendered. Natasha was about to answer when she heard the shatter of glass. They all looked at the door, starting to see faint green smoke emerging from it. They started to approach until Steve emerged, running out.

“Shut the door!” He demanded.  Clint rushed over, slamming it shut, stopping any more smoke. Steve had rushed past them, not giving them time to look at what he was holding tightly as he cleared a table of the things on it, gently laying you down on it.

“Oh my god.” Natasha commented, rushing over, with Tony and Clint not far behind, soon surrounding you with Steve. “That’s the kid from the case you’ve been working on.”

“Y/N. Their name is Y/N…” Steve told her, though he was more focussed on you. You weren’t breathing, and you were growing paler and paler. He pressed his head to your chest, listening intently, before pulling away, putting his hand on top of his other, curling the fingers into the palm of his other hand, and starting to press hard and fast on your chest.

“What the hell happened down there?” Clint asked.

“They were in a holding cell… they were trying to get rid of the evidence by killing them. Agent L/N and her husband are dead, Y/N was the only one not dead down there when I arrived. The toxic gas they used to kill them was being pumped in as I was smashing the glass.” Steve explained, continuing to press on your chest.

“I’ll alert base, Nat, prep the jet, Clint, get it right outside.” Tony took charge, his two other teammates doing as told while Tony focussed on alerting SHIELD on Steve finding you, and needing back up to move the surrendered due to you now being a top priority on this mission. Steve was deaf and blind to it all, solely focussed the 14 year old in front of him who was relying on him. He eventually saw your throat move, taking in air, and he quickly pressed his ear to your chest again, squeezing his eyes shut and just praying for a heartbeat. He sighed with relief at the gentle thump he heard.

Clint got the jet right outside the main doors as the retrieval team arrived, and they were off back to base as the surrendered were being rounded up and arrested. The flight was deathly silent. Clint and Natasha flew the jet, leaving Tony and Steve with you. Tony only watched as Steve took complete control over your care. He had you on his lap, still cradling you in a blanket, and Tony was wondering if he saw a 14 year old teenager, or the 8 year old missing child that he’d been torturing himself be seeing day in, day out.

“What’s gonna happen to the kid?” Tony asked, looking over at Clint and Natasha. There was a second of silence, only prolonged when they felt the eyes of Steve as well. Eventually Clint sighed, and spoke up.

“Children of dead agents aren’t uncommon, and usually if the agent dies, we provide the financial support for that child and their parent or guardian until that kid’s 18, like child support… However, they’ve lost both parents, but they’re still under the protection of SHIELD because of their mom… I dunno, maybe put them in a foster family with another agent or-“

“I’ll adopt them.” Both Clint and Natasha took their eyes away from flying to look back at Steve in shock. Steve however, didn’t seem phased by his own words, still focussed on you, the kid in his lap was still sick and in need of urgent care. “You do it Clint, so I don’t know why I can’t. I’ve been looking for this kid since I joined SHIELD, and I wasn’t able to save their parents, but I can still save them.” He explained.

Every agent who was involved in your case, including Maria and Fury themselves came to see your arrival. They were hoping for a healthy kid and two parents, and frowned when they saw Steve carrying you, wrapped in a blanket and only followed by his team. He looked up at Maria, who nodded and led him to the medical bay, while the rest of the team stayed behind to tell Fury of Steve’s request.

With some simple medication, oxygen mask and a little rest, you were as right as rain. Steve stayed by your side till you were healthy enough to be woken up, and it was pretty reassuring to see the man who saved you there, waiting. “Hello.” You greeted, making the man smile.

“Hi Y/N. I’m Steve.” He greeted you back. He spent the next few days just talking with you none stop. By the end of the first day, he knew your favourite food, colour, and by the end of the third he got a good read on your personality. Fury had agreed to let Steve adopt you, but only with your permission. He brought it up on the 5th day, and by the end of the week, you’d left the hospital to go live in a tower full of superheroes with a man determined to be the best dad he can be to you. You knew you were in good hands and that you were safe now.

Hope you like it! If you have any questions, please send them in!

*Not my gif

They were having to move fast to get in before the group could destroy evidence, both inanimate and alive. “Tony, go from above, Clint, get to the second level, Natasha you’re first.” Steve ordered, throwing his shield to hit some agents with guns, punching through them and grabbing his shield again to proceed with Natasha through the first floor. Natasha went forward, dealing with the agents who hadn’t surrendered, while Steve noticed a door to the left. He got a bad- an awful feeling about that door, so he raised his shield, heading over to the door slowly. He could feel the agents all staring at him, and he knew that they were hiding something behind that door.

He opened it, finding stairs. “I’m heading down here Natasha, secure this place, I’ll be back soon.” Steve announced. Natasha only nodded as she worked in handcuffing the multitude of agents, before Steve jogged down the stairs.

He came to a room, both sides of the room occupied with cells with the wall made of glass to show everything inside. They left only a narrow hallway for Steve to walk passed, and he realised what was going on, and it made him sick. The rooms were clouded with some green gas, and he could see bodies of people pressed up against the glass, not moving. This gas was poisonous, and they’d been killed. He walked passed them all, looking at each until he froze at one. The body, while curled up, could be made out as Agent L/N, her face etched into madness and pain, but eyes dull and skin pale. “Shit…” He almost didn’t want to turn, but had to, seeing her husband in the opposite cell in a similar state. He felt everything he’d been trying to do for all those years on the case were for nothing, and it made him feel more angry that he’ll never know what HYDRA wanted from them or what they did to you… wait, where we you?

His eyes shifted, seeing only two more cells. The one next to your father was filled with the clouded poison, and he was worried that he had found you… but the body was too big. He walked a little further, looking into the last cell… and he saw you.

You’d given up. You were curled up, sat against the wall with your head in your knees, your back jolting lightly occasionally. You were crying. It tore Steve up, but also gave him hope. He had to get you out of here. He could see your cell clearly, seeing the ventilation, knowing they could fill the room and kill you at any second. He tightened his grip on his shield, pulling his arm back and hitting hit against the glass.

You jumped at the sound, away from the glass, seeing the man with a shield who had managed to crack the glass, though it didn’t shatter. You looked at him like he was the first human you’d seen in years, before snapping out of your moment when a hissing sound released from behind you. You looked back, seeing green smoke emerging from the vents. You knew what it was, and scrambled up, hitting the glass as well. “Please! Please!” You begged desperately. Steve took another swing at the glass, though it still wouldn’t shatter. You started to cough, the feeling of light headedness and tiredness filling your body. Your punches to the glass became weaker, until you fell to your knees. Steve continued to try and break the glass.

“Where’s Steve?” Tony asked after regrouping. The raid was a success, and they had all met on the first floor to hold all the surrendered. Natasha was about to answer when she heard the shatter of glass. They all looked at the door, starting to see faint green smoke emerging from it. They started to approach until Steve emerged, running out.

“Shut the door!” He demanded.  Clint rushed over, slamming it shut, stopping any more smoke. Steve had rushed past them, not giving them time to look at what he was holding tightly as he cleared a table of the things on it, gently laying you down on it.

“Oh my god.” Natasha commented, rushing over, with Tony and Clint not far behind, soon surrounding you with Steve. “That’s the kid from the case you’ve been working on.”

“Y/N. Their name is Y/N…” Steve told her, though he was more focussed on you. You weren’t breathing, and you were growing paler and paler. He pressed his head to your chest, listening intently, before pulling away, putting his hand on top of his other, curling the fingers into the palm of his other hand, and starting to press hard and fast on your chest.

“What the hell happened down there?” Clint asked.

“They were in a holding cell… they were trying to get rid of the evidence by killing them. Agent L/N and her husband are dead, Y/N was the only one not dead down there when I arrived. The toxic gas they used to kill them was being pumped in as I was smashing the glass.” Steve explained, continuing to press on your chest.

“I’ll alert base, Nat, prep the jet, Clint, get it right outside.” Tony took charge, his two other teammates doing as told while Tony focussed on alerting SHIELD on Steve finding you, and needing back up to move the surrendered due to you now being a top priority on this mission. Steve was deaf and blind to it all, solely focussed the 14 year old in front of him who was relying on him. He eventually saw your throat move, taking in air, and he quickly pressed his ear to your chest again, squeezing his eyes shut and just praying for a heartbeat. He sighed with relief at the gentle thump he heard.

Clint got the jet right outside the main doors as the retrieval team arrived, and they were off back to base as the surrendered were being rounded up and arrested. The flight was deathly silent. Clint and Natasha flew the jet, leaving Tony and Steve with you. Tony only watched as Steve took complete control over your care. He had you on his lap, still cradling you in a blanket, and Tony was wondering if he saw a 14 year old teenager, or the 8 year old missing child that he’d been torturing himself be seeing day in, day out.

“What’s gonna happen to the kid?” Tony asked, looking over at Clint and Natasha. There was a second of silence, only prolonged when they felt the eyes of Steve as well. Eventually Clint sighed, and spoke up.

“Children of dead agents aren’t uncommon, and usually if the agent dies, we provide the financial support for that child and their parent or guardian until that kid’s 18, like child support… However, they’ve lost both parents, but they’re still under the protection of SHIELD because of their mom… I dunno, maybe put them in a foster family with another agent or-“

“I’ll adopt them.” Both Clint and Natasha took their eyes away from flying to look back at Steve in shock. Steve however, didn’t seem phased by his own words, still focussed on you, the kid in his lap was still sick and in need of urgent care. “You do it Clint, so I don’t know why I can’t. I’ve been looking for this kid since I joined SHIELD, and I wasn’t able to save their parents, but I can still save them.” He explained.

Every agent who was involved in your case, including Maria and Fury themselves came to see your arrival. They were hoping for a healthy kid and two parents, and frowned when they saw Steve carrying you, wrapped in a blanket and only followed by his team. He looked up at Maria, who nodded and led him to the medical bay, while the rest of the team stayed behind to tell Fury of Steve’s request.

With some simple medication, oxygen mask and a little rest, you were as right as rain. Steve stayed by your side till you were healthy enough to be woken up, and it was pretty reassuring to see the man who saved you there, waiting. “Hello.” You greeted, making the man smile.

“Hi Y/N. I’m Steve.” He greeted you back. He spent the next few days just talking with you none stop. By the end of the first day, he knew your favourite food, colour, and by the end of the third he got a good read on your personality. Fury had agreed to let Steve adopt you, but only with your permission. He brought it up on the 5th day, and by the end of the week, you’d left the hospital to go live in a tower full of superheroes with a man determined to be the best dad he can be to you. You knew you were in good hands and that you were safe now.

Hope you like it! If you have any questions, please send them in!

Searching the house found no sign of a struggle, but there was a little bit of blood found in your bed, confirmed to be yours.

It had been 7 years, and the case was cold. It bothered a lot of people, and that included Steve Rogers. Especially Steve Rogers.

He wasn’t assigned to your case, but he had found your file report and Maria, who had been helping with the investigation told him you were a missing person under the protection of SHIELD. Steve straight out begged to be part of the case, and Fury allowed it. He found out everything that they had known about yours and your family’s case, and it made him sick to his stomach.

He came up with some theories that ultimately allowed the case to gain some heat. He came up with the theory that you had coughed up the blood and your father was planning to rush you to hospital, but got caught on the way there. That then brought up that you were supposedly ill with just a bit of vomiting from a school bug, proven by your mom going to pharmacy to pick up the tablets. However, he then asked if they had found the tablets in the house. They said yes, but hadn’t actually tested them. Turns out they were actually mild poison. It was all planned. You were ill, a bug probably passed around at your school, and they used it to their advantage. While it was progress, Steve still felt awful about the whole thing. He instructed an investigation on the pharmacist who sold the drugs, only to find out that he had been hired a week before hand, and left 5 weeks after your disappearance. There was no doubt he was with HYDRA, hired purely to make sure you got worse so your dad would take you to the hospital, and on the way they could attack. Your mom had left early, due to your dad calling to tell her about your condition. They’d used you, a child, as leverage. And that infuriated him.

summary: Ich weiß, was Du bei NOIZZ getan hast …
title: Ich weiß, was Du bei NOIZZ getan hast …
body:
Wie die Zeit doch vergeht. Mein zweites Volontariatsjahr ist schon im vollen Gange. Mittlerweile bin ich wieder bei meiner Stammredaktion BILD Sport Video angekommen. Mit der Fußball Weltmeisterschaft gab es dort auch gleich aller Hand zu tun. Doch das ist ein Thema für einen anderen Tag. Heute soll es um meine Zeit bei NOIZZ von April bis Juni gehen.


Einige Tage vor meinem Start bei BILDs Millennials-Marke erhielt ich vom dortigen Chef eine Mail, in der er mich bat, ihm mitzuteilen, welche Themenbereiche ich in den nächsten Monaten abdecken wollen würde. Als er auf meine Antwort Sport erwiderte, dass dies bei NOIZZ keine große Rolle spielen würde, stieg meine Motivation nicht gerade ins Unendliche.

Trotzdem bekam ich die Gelegenheit, einige Stücke rund um die Leibesübungen zu schreiben, tobte mich aber auch auf anderen Gebieten aus. Hier eine kleine Auswahl:

Filmkritiken

Für die Avengers, Solo und Deadpool wäre ich eh ins Kino gegangen. Diese Film schon vor dem offiziellen Start sehen zu können, war ein nettes Schmankerl. Da schrieben sich die Kritiken fast von alleine. Ich hatte zwar die Befürchtung als Fan aller drei Filmreihen etwas zu euphorisch zu werden, doch zumindest bei Solo war diese Sorge unangebracht. Der Streifen war einfach zu schlecht, um ihn über den grünen Klee zu loben.

title: Dream On
body:
Peter Parker x male reader

Fandom: Marvel (Spider-Man: Homecoming)
Genre: Fluff with a very small hint of angst
Pairing: Peter Parker (Holland) x male reader
Word count: 1078
Y/N= Your Name
Y/N/N= Your nickname
Summary: This is the sequel to my fic ‘Dream’ that I posted some time ago. You can find it here
Author’s Note: I had so much fun writing this, I hope you enjoy it!

Requests and Ships are open

Masterlist

Part I: Dream

Peter had been nervous the whole day. He couldn’t concentrate on anything, he was so excited, that he couldn’t sit still. Ned had asked him about it at school, but Peter denied his nervousness.  


“I’m Spider-Man.” That’s what Peter wanted to tell Y/N. But he had been way too scared to do so. He had decided to do it on this day. He would finally tell his boyfriend that he was Spider-Man. There had never been a good opportunity but this one time when Y/N saw him wearing the mask, but Peter hadn’t been ready back then.

Waiting felt like hell to Peter. He sat at his desk in his room, his fingers were constantly tapping the wood of the table. Peter looked at his phone for the third time in this minute. Still thirty minutes until Y/N would come to visit him. Peter wasn’t even sure if Y/N was going to come. He hadn’t read Peter’s message yet. It wasn’t unusual that Y/N didn’t read his messages. He was pretty busy and didn’t have time for his boyfriend the whole day. Peter understood that, but he still wanted to see Y/N as often as possible. And especially today it was really important to him to see Y/N, or he’d never be brave enough to tell his boyfriend the truth.

Peter decided that it didn’t make any sense to keep studying. He couldn’t concentrate anyway, so he threw his pen on the table, when he heard the notification sound of his phone.

A message from Y/N. He opened it with shaking hands.

Y/N: K, I’m gonna be there in a few

Peter: How long?

Y/N: Not sure yet. You can be lucky that I read your message now that I’m near your house

Y/N: Five minutes and I’m there

Five minutes. Peter sighed in relieve. His joy didn’t last long, it changed into fear really quickly. What was he going to say? How would Y/N react? Peter had been keeping his identity a secret from his boyfriend for such a long time now! Would Y/N be mad at Peter for not telling him?

Aunt May’s voice got his attention.
“Peter! Your boyfriend is here!” Peter jumped up and ran to the door to pull Y/N into a tight hug. Y/N stumbled and laughed.
“You’re acting like we haven’t seen each other in years,” he said, and Peter let go off him. Peter scraped the back of his head.
“Sometimes it feels like that,” he mumbled and looked down. Y/N laughed and was going to respond, but aunt May cleared her throat and announced, “I’m going to the shops in a few minutes. Do you guys need anything?” Peter shook his head.
“No, thanks May.”
His aunt nodded and took her jacket. Peter grabbed his Y/N’s hand and pulled him to his room.

“Are you okay Peter?” Y/N asked after he sat down on Peter’s bed. “You are behaving really weird.” Y/N sounded worried, but Peter tried to laugh it off.
“What are you talking about? I’m good. Everything’s fine!” He said, but he wasn’t able to convince Y/N.
“Peter. What’s going on? Tell me! Did I do something wrong?”
Peter sighed and shook his head.
“No. No, it’s not you. It’s something different,” he admitted. Y/N furrowed his brows in concern, and put his hand on Peter’s shoulder.
“You don’t have to talk about it, if you don’t want to,” Y/N said, but Peter shook his head. He pushed his boyfriend’s hand off his shoulder and stood up. He walked towards the door and assured that his aunt wasn’t home anymore. Y/N watched every single of his movements carefully.
“Peter…” He whispered, but he was cut off.
“Y/N, I have something to tell you,” Peter started and took a deep breath. “I have a secret I’ve never told you about. I wasn’t sure how you would react. Please, don’t be mad at me. Promise?” Y/N nodded without saying anything.
“I’m Spider-Man.” Peter’s heart stopped when the words left his mouth. Y/N sat there in silence, looking at his boyfriend. Peter avoided his gaze. Was he mad?
“You’re Spider-Man,” Y/N said a few seconds later. It wasn’t a question and sounded more like a simple statement. Peter nodded.
“Yeah.”

Y/N let out a small laughter.
“Impossible. Like the one time I dreamed of you taking the mask off? That was real?” He asked. Peter nodded again.
“Yes.”
Y/N laughed loudly and threw his head back.
“Prove it.” Peter’s heart dropped.
“You don’t believe me,” he whispered.
“Prove it. You’ll only get a kiss if you can,” Y/N giggled.
“Ok,” was all Peter said before he took the suit Tony Stark made for him out of his closet. He undressed himself and dressed in the red suit. Y/N watched him, his mouth was slightly open. Once Peter had pulled the mask over his head, his boyfriend shook his head in disbelief.
“I’m still dreaming. That’s not happening,” Y/N muttered and covered his eyes with his hands. Peter took his boyfriend’s wrists and put his hands down again.
“Come on, Y/N/N.”
“Where did you get this from?”, Y/N asked and pointed on the suit.
“Tony Stark made it for me,” Peter answered. “I’m doing this internship, you know?”
“How could I not know? You’re talking about it all the time,” Y/N pointed out. “So this is what you are doing there all the time? What can you do with the suit?” Peter chuckled.
“I’m glad you ask.” In the next moment, Peter was hanging upside-down from the ceiling. Y/N let out a soft Wow.
“I can shoot webs and stuff-” Peter shot at the window. “I can walk on the ceiling. Pretty cool, huh?” Y/N nodded, his mouth was still open.
“How did you become Spider-Man?” He asked after he found his ability to speak.
“A radioactive spider bit me,” Peter answered and shrugged like it was nothing special.
“And you didn’t go to the doctor or anything?” There was worry in Y/N’s voice. Peter ignored the question.

“Do you believe me now?” He wanted to know and pulled his mask off. Y/N stood up from the bed and walked towards Peter. He ran his fingertips over the red fabric of the suit. Peter’s eyes followed his boyfriend’s hands and he smiled softly.
“Yes,” Y/N whispered and Peter sighed in relieve.
“Are you going to kiss me now?” Peter chuckled and Y/N laughed.
“Dream on, Parker!” But he kissed him anyway.

Masterlist

Part I: Dream

Peter had been nervous the whole day. He couldn’t concentrate on anything, he was so excited, that he couldn’t sit still. Ned had asked him about it at school, but Peter denied his nervousness.  


“I’m Spider-Man.” That’s what Peter wanted to tell Y/N. But he had been way too scared to do so. He had decided to do it on this day. He would finally tell his boyfriend that he was Spider-Man. There had never been a good opportunity but this one time when Y/N saw him wearing the mask, but Peter hadn’t been ready back then.

[[MORE]]

Waiting felt like hell to Peter. He sat at his desk in his room, his fingers were constantly tapping the wood of the table. Peter looked at his phone for the third time in this minute. Still thirty minutes until Y/N would come to visit him. Peter wasn’t even sure if Y/N was going to come. He hadn’t read Peter’s message yet. It wasn’t unusual that Y/N didn’t read his messages. He was pretty busy and didn’t have time for his boyfriend the whole day. Peter understood that, but he still wanted to see Y/N as often as possible. And especially today it was really important to him to see Y/N, or he’d never be brave enough to tell his boyfriend the truth.

Peter decided that it didn’t make any sense to keep studying. He couldn’t concentrate anyway, so he threw his pen on the table, when he heard the notification sound of his phone.

A message from Y/N. He opened it with shaking hands.

Y/N: K, I’m gonna be there in a few

Peter: How long?

Y/N: Not sure yet. You can be lucky that I read your message now that I’m near your house

Y/N: Five minutes and I’m there

Five minutes. Peter sighed in relieve. His joy didn’t last long, it changed into fear really quickly. What was he going to say? How would Y/N react? Peter had been keeping his identity a secret from his boyfriend for such a long time now! Would Y/N be mad at Peter for not telling him?

Aunt May’s voice got his attention.
“Peter! Your boyfriend is here!” Peter jumped up and ran to the door to pull Y/N into a tight hug. Y/N stumbled and laughed.
“You’re acting like we haven’t seen each other in years,” he said, and Peter let go off him. Peter scraped the back of his head.
“Sometimes it feels like that,” he mumbled and looked down. Y/N laughed and was going to respond, but aunt May cleared her throat and announced, “I’m going to the shops in a few minutes. Do you guys need anything?” Peter shook his head.
“No, thanks May.”
His aunt nodded and took her jacket. Peter grabbed his Y/N’s hand and pulled him to his room.

“Are you okay Peter?” Y/N asked after he sat down on Peter’s bed. “You are behaving really weird.” Y/N sounded worried, but Peter tried to laugh it off.
“What are you talking about? I’m good. Everything’s fine!” He said, but he wasn’t able to convince Y/N.
“Peter. What’s going on? Tell me! Did I do something wrong?”
Peter sighed and shook his head.
“No. No, it’s not you. It’s something different,” he admitted. Y/N furrowed his brows in concern, and put his hand on Peter’s shoulder.
“You don’t have to talk about it, if you don’t want to,” Y/N said, but Peter shook his head. He pushed his boyfriend’s hand off his shoulder and stood up. He walked towards the door and assured that his aunt wasn’t home anymore. Y/N watched every single of his movements carefully.
“Peter…” He whispered, but he was cut off.
“Y/N, I have something to tell you,” Peter started and took a deep breath. “I have a secret I’ve never told you about. I wasn’t sure how you would react. Please, don’t be mad at me. Promise?” Y/N nodded without saying anything.
“I’m Spider-Man.” Peter’s heart stopped when the words left his mouth. Y/N sat there in silence, looking at his boyfriend. Peter avoided his gaze. Was he mad?
“You’re Spider-Man,” Y/N said a few seconds later. It wasn’t a question and sounded more like a simple statement. Peter nodded.
“Yeah.”

Y/N let out a small laughter.
“Impossible. Like the one time I dreamed of you taking the mask off? That was real?” He asked. Peter nodded again.
“Yes.”
Y/N laughed loudly and threw his head back.
“Prove it.” Peter’s heart dropped.
“You don’t believe me,” he whispered.
“Prove it. You’ll only get a kiss if you can,” Y/N giggled.
“Ok,” was all Peter said before he took the suit Tony Stark made for him out of his closet. He undressed himself and dressed in the red suit. Y/N watched him, his mouth was slightly open. Once Peter had pulled the mask over his head, his boyfriend shook his head in disbelief.
“I’m still dreaming. That’s not happening,” Y/N muttered and covered his eyes with his hands. Peter took his boyfriend’s wrists and put his hands down again.
“Come on, Y/N/N.”
“Where did you get this from?”, Y/N asked and pointed on the suit.
“Tony Stark made it for me,” Peter answered. “I’m doing this internship, you know?”
“How could I not know? You’re talking about it all the time,” Y/N pointed out. “So this is what you are doing there all the time? What can you do with the suit?” Peter chuckled.
“I’m glad you ask.” In the next moment, Peter was hanging upside-down from the ceiling. Y/N let out a soft Wow.
“I can shoot webs and stuff-” Peter shot at the window. “I can walk on the ceiling. Pretty cool, huh?” Y/N nodded, his mouth was still open.
“How did you become Spider-Man?” He asked after he found his ability to speak.
“A radioactive spider bit me,” Peter answered and shrugged like it was nothing special.
“And you didn’t go to the doctor or anything?” There was worry in Y/N’s voice. Peter ignored the question.

“Do you believe me now?” He wanted to know and pulled his mask off. Y/N stood up from the bed and walked towards Peter. He ran his fingertips over the red fabric of the suit. Peter’s eyes followed his boyfriend’s hands and he smiled softly.
“Yes,” Y/N whispered and Peter sighed in relieve.
“Are you going to kiss me now?” Peter chuckled and Y/N laughed.
“Dream on, Parker!” But he kissed him anyway.

Tony: Thor’s brother, Loki?

Peter: Yes?

Tony: The one who tried to rule world, Loki? Who killed 80+ people?

Peter: Yes, but he didn’t mean to- he was controlled by Than-

Loki: *Jumps out* BOO B ITCH.

body:
Conversation with my mom today:

Me: We need to go see that movie! It has Benedict Cumberbatch in it!

Mom: I’ll go support him when he does Sherlock again.

Me: So we are boycotting all non-Sherlock Cumberbatch projects?

Mom: Exactly.

Me: What about the Avengers?

Mom: That’s the one exception I’ll allow.

Guys, I come by it honestly.

tags: im a total nerd with this shit
body:
Ummmmm

Okay. I just stayed up far too goddamn late to watch Avengers Infinity War because I shamefully hadn’t seen it yet, and what?!?

(SPOILER ALERT)

I don’t know whether to be bewildered, angry, or sad. All of the above, maybe?

I mean, not gonna lie, totally thought Cap or Stark was gonna die, but still….

Like what the fuck happens now?! Did half of the universe really just die? Are the Avengers gonna go on this insane revenge mission? How will they be able to reach Thanos at this point? And what the fuck is up with Thanos’ “paradise”? It doesn’t even make sense. He has this already pre-built paradise but everyone else is in misery. Is the point to just rebuild so it’s a better world or something? So many cliff hangers.

Also, did anyone else eye roll when the Black Panther turned to dust? Like, of course one of the two most important Avengers you kill off is black… idk, maybe there’s more in store for Spidey and Black Panther when Thanos returns, but oie.

Anyways. It was SO good, and I loved it. I’m mostly just upset that I’m so exhausted, but now my mind is racing. Dreams of the Avengers, here I come (just please let them be with Thor 😉)!
